result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
original filed in 15CF471 
-of Initial Appearance held on February 1, 2016 
-of Preliminary Hearing held on February 15, 2016

original filed in 15CF476 
-of Plea Hearing held on May 25, 2016 
-of Sentencing Hearing held on August 11, 2016
Restitution Summary for Altenburg Dairy in the amount of $170
Sentencing hearing on August 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher A Philipp in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-476, 15CM-367, 15CF-471 and 15CF-475.

11:45 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address for Defendant is verified.

State provided the Court with the offer in the form of a chart, because there are so many charges in the cases.

15CF-476:
Defendant will plead to Count 1, 2, 3, 5, and 6.
Counts 4, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15 are dismissed and readin
15CF-475, 15CF-471 and 15CM-376 are dismissed and read in

State also submitted an uncharged read in, 15PT-1817.

State requests a PSI. State agrees to cap confinement at 7 years. There will also be restitution sought.

State has complied with victim notification statues.
There are no victims present in this case.

Atty Schmidt concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
GUILTY to  Counts 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 in 15CF-476.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-476: Count 1 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 2 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 3 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 5 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Count 6 Burglary, as a party to the crime
15CF-476: Counts 4, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15 are dismissed and read in
15CF-475: Dismissed and read in
15CF-471: Dismissed and read in
15CM-367: Dismissed and read in

Parties are recommending a PSI.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
Report be completed at least one week prior to sentencing and provided to the parties.

Court is inclined to revoke bond.
Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding bond. 

Court questions Defendant as to employment.
Atty Schmidt replies as to assurance of appearing and not committing any more crimes.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not revoke bond. Court will need to get permission to hear this on August 11th from Branch 3. 
Bond is continued.
Plea hearing on May 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A Philipp in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All cases heard: 15CF471, 15CF475 & 15CF476
3:55 p.m. Court calls the cases. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Atty Karl Schmidt
filed by Atty Karl Schmidt
Preliminary hearing at 02-15-2016 03:00 pm

$500 cash bond set for each case 15CF471, 15CF475, 15CF476  for a total of $1,500.00.  No contact with the victims their residences or their business as listed in the complaints of each case 15CF471, 15CF475, and 15CF476.

Defendant Christopher A Philipp appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states the public defender has not come to see him.  ADA Constable states the public defender may be looking for an attorney outside the area.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-25-2016 01:30 pm

2:15 p.m. Defendant Christopher A Philipp appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CF475, 15CF471 and 15CF476.  Defendant needs to apply for a public defender.  Defendant on huber for other matters.
Atty Drengler informs the Court he will have someone to see the defendant.
Bond will be address at the next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
